definition: to get sth done once and for all
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
to toil/labor/laborer/to put sb to trouble (of doing sth)/meritorious deed/to console (Taiwan pr. [lao4] for this sense)
forever/always/perpetual
to escape/leisurely/outstanding

sentences.english: More and more brides select tea length wedding ceremony dresses once and for all motives.
sentences.chinese: 越来越多的新娘选择茶长度婚礼礼服一劳永逸的动机。

sentences.english: See if you can handle this young trouble-maker once and for all .
sentences.chinese: 看看你能不能把那个小捣乱分子一劳永逸的打发走。

sentences.english: This is not an one-time event.
sentences.chinese: 这并非一件一劳永逸的事情。

sentences.english: We have solved this problem once for all.
sentences.chinese: 我们已经一劳永逸地解决了这个问题。

sentences.english: See if you can handle this young trouble-maker once and for all.
sentences.chinese: 看看你能不能把那个小捣乱分子一劳永逸的打发走。

definition: to accomplish the whole task at one stroke (idiom)
pinyin: bi4 qi2 gong1 yu2 yi1 yi4

definition: to eradicate
to treat the symptoms but not the root cause
to sleep peacefully (idiom)/(fig.) to rest easy/to be free of worries
to settle a matter in one go
to satisfy rival demands (idiom)/to get the best of both worlds/to have it both ways/to have one's cake and eat it too
plan of convenience (idiom); stop-gap measure/makeshift stratagem/interim step
circumstances require action (idiom); absolutely necessary/imperative
to take drastic measures to deal with a situation/to pull the carpet from under sb
the best policy/the best thing one can do in the circumstances
won't work/will get (you) nowhere
surefire; absolutely safe (idiom)
everything is fine (idiom); all is well with the world
feasible
solution/method to settle an issue
to settle (a dispute)/to resolve/to solve/to dispose of/to dispatch
